means: 毁坏或亵渎( desecrate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The earth is to be honoured; it is not to be desecrated.
sentence.Network_cn: 大地应该受到敬仰，而不该被亵渎。

sentence.Network_en: The invading army desecrated this holy place when they camped here.
sentence.Network_cn: 侵略军在这块圣地上扎营就是对这块圣地的亵渎.

sentence.Network_en: She shouldn't have desecrated the picture of a religious leader.
sentence.Network_cn: 她不该亵渎宗教领袖的画像。

PerfectNetExp.abs: many desecrated shrines and cemeteries ., 许多被亵渎的神殿和墓地.

list.abs: you desecrate your real father's memory .你亵渎了你父亲的名声。
descried desecrate 亵渎亵圣desecration desegregate 取消隔离desegregation deselect 否决取消选项
Vandals desecrated many tombstones in the cemetery ., 破坏狂亵渎了许多墓园中的墓碑.
I desecrated a pure heart., 我亵渎了一个纯真的心灵.

entry.tran: 亵渎，玷污(神圣或特别的事物)
entry.def: If someone desecrates something which is considered to be holy or very special, they deliberately damage or insult it.

example.ex: She shouldn't have desecrated the picture of a religious leader...
example.tran: 她不该亵渎宗教领袖的画像。

example.ex: The earth is to be honoured; it is not to be desecrated.
example.tran: 大地应该受到敬仰，而不该被亵渎。

auth_sentence.content: It is a historic site and it has been desecrated.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is a historic site and it has been desecrated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is a historic site and it has been desecrated.

auth_sentence.content: The...vessels of the Temple...were desecrated by being employed in idol-worship.
auth_sentence.res_content: The...vessels of the Temple...were desecrated by being employed in idol-worship.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The...vessels of the Temple...were desecrated by being employed in idol-worship.

auth_sentence.content: Mosques are desecrated and sensibilities grossly offended.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mosques are desecrated and sensibilities grossly offended.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mosques are desecrated and sensibilities grossly offended.
